column1: The grounds of appeal set forth by the appellant are as follows:

column2: The  Learned  Trial  Judge  erred  in  law  by  failing  to  consider,  that  it  is
unsafe to convict the appellant by relying on the voice identification.
The  Learned  High  Court  Judge  has  erred  in  holding  that  PW1  was  a
hostile witness to the prosecution, where the prosecution had not made
any such application in terms of section 154 of the Evidence Ordinance.
PW4 was threatened by the prosecutor when she was giving evidence.
The  Learned  Trial  Judge  erred  in  holding  that  the  evidence  of  PW1  was
corroborated by the short history given to the doctor.
